availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Capital of Virginia. Also the capital of the Confederate States of America during the Civil War (1861-1865). During the Civil War, was also a center of rail and industry, military hospitals, and prisoner-of-war camps and prisons, including Belle Isle and Libby Prison.

bibl.p: DeCredico, Mary and Jaime Amanda Martinez, "Richmond during the Civil War," in Encyclopedia Virginia, https://www.encyclopediavirginia.org/RichmondDuringtheCivilWar#start_entry (accessed 8 Aug 2017).
